<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CurrLgkmcnt &gt; Lgkmcnt &amp;&amp; CyclesToWaitLgkm &lt; CyclesToWait)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CurrVscnt &gt; Vscnt &amp;&amp; CyclesToWaitVs &lt; CyclesToWait)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">    CyclesToWait = CyclesToWaitVs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We may underestimate how many cycles we need to wait, but this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// isn&#39;t a big deal. Our return value is just how many cycles until</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this function gets run again. So as long as we don&#39;t overestimate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the wait time, we&#39;ll still end up stalling at this instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the correct number of cycles.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CyclesToWait == ~0U)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CyclesToWait;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(OpReg &amp;&amp; OpReg-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/mcaoperand/#ae928a336affb345430086087a985ee02">isReg</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;First operand should be a register.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(OpImm &amp;&amp; OpImm-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/mcaoperand/#a88d9b7fa57d068cafadbbb4756563b52">isImm</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Second operand should be an immediate.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OpReg-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/mcaoperand/#a30cd5cb4c2650a395a826f822ab03790">getReg</a>() != AMDGPU::SGPR&#95;NULL) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instruction is using a real register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since we can&#39;t know what value this register will have,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we can&#39;t compute what the value of this wait should be.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/withcolor/#a237ad6eae22f6b2746a542c02d309a5b">WithColor::warning</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;The register component of &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal">                           &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a15a50057bc7184990fc2b2885321821b">MCII</a>.getName(Opcode) &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; will be completely &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal">                           &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;ignored. So the wait may not be accurate.\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">switch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Opcode) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Redundant switch so I don&#39;t have to repeat the code above</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for each case. There are more clever ways to avoid this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// extra switch and anyone can feel free to implement one of them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AMDGPUCustomBehaviour::generateWaitCntInfo() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The core logic from this function is taken from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SIInsertWaitcnts::updateEventWaitcntAfter() In that pass, the instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that are being looked at are in the MachineInstr format, whereas we have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// access to the MCInst format. The side effects of this are that we can&#39;t use</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the mayAccessVMEMThroughFlat(Inst) or mayAccessLDSThroughFlat(Inst)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// functions. Therefore, we conservatively assume that these functions will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// return true. This may cause a few instructions to be incorrectly tagged</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with an extra CNT. However, these are instructions that do interact with at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// least one CNT so giving them an extra CNT shouldn&#39;t cause issues in most</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scenarios.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  AMDGPU::IsaVersion <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/#a4c450943f424116a9b6b9a3db451af6c">AMDGPU::getIsaVersion</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a8f327d1084786084e10242b9868cdf74">STI</a>.getCPU());</Highlight></CodeLine>
